lexUnit.name: mumble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something indistinctly and quietly.

sentence.text: ` Scribble , scribble , scribble , " I mumbled .
` Am I ? " he mumbled .
` Buona sera , signor , " he mumbled .
` I 'm sorry , Roger , " he mumbled .
“ I should n't have been so … hostile , ” she mumbled .
I did n't mean to disturb you , " I mumbled apologetically .
` He 's been so kind , " mumbled Daisy .
` Come on , honey , " mumbled Luke .
` God , what an accursed night ! " mumbled Mr Beckenham , and , sipping his liquor , he looked over the makeshift meal with revulsion .
` And you think I do ? " mumbled the ill-shaven Morse .
` I 'm not really sure why I 'm here , " mumbled Jimmy .
I choked back the tears and mumbled that I was glad I 'd had cancer .
Vlitos mumbled that ` it 's probably got residual sugar in it " .
I sucked my thumb and mumbled that I had n't meant to do it .
He mumbled that he was still in a state of shock and had been walking around in a dream all day .
He turned eyes hard with disgust on Dana , and Claudia was n't at all surprised when her sister mumbled that Garry was waiting for her in a café in the main street .
He kept mumbling that he 'd met ` the very Devil himself " and was shivering terribly .
He mumbled words and phrases from the song quietly enough for the noise to drown them until a man returned to his side and stopped .
She mumbled something while Flora supported her and I wiped her face with the warm , fizzy water .
All shook their heads or mumbled a negative .
Athelstan smiled and mumbled his congratulations .
They mumble the name of a nearby village .
We rose , bowed to Queen Margaret , mumbled our apologies and crept out of the hall .
Still mumbling the phrase ` Have one yourself " under his breath , Neville pulled two pints of the Swan 's finest .
The girl , obviously acutely embarrassed , mumbled something about Bert maybe knowing a bit more , ` him being there , like " .
He mumbles some nonsense about clowns being the cause of peace -- perhaps the money for the convention is the peace dividend ?
Waller , still retreating , turning away to go back into his room , had mumbled something about something or other .
` How 's the shop ? " mumbles one balding sweating man to another .
Tom mumbled something to himself and handed it to him .
He mumbled a thanks for the coffee .
He shook his head and mumbled something under his breath .
Len looked apologetic and woebegone , and mumbled something about not letting down his mates .
Oh … that reminds me … when you came round , you mumbled something about having heard me calling you .
Only one old lay brother , a hoary old man , mumbled about the abbey being the dark pit for the evil deeds of the Great Ones of the land . "
The girl shrugged and mumbled about him being too busy .
` Nothing of importance , he just mumbled about shadows , shadows on the Kinghorn Ness .
Round-shouldered men mumbled quietly to frumpy girls in spectacles or Filipino nurses who neighed dutifully at jokes they did not understand .
Mr Piggott mumbled gloomily to himself .
` Now or never , " he mumbled to himself .
` There 's much to be done , " he mumbled to himself .
Miles was mumbling to himself .
` I passed by death , " I mumbled to myself .
` Do n't you dare cry , " I mumbled to myself .
George mumbled incoherently to them .
Clare mumbled with difficulty , ` No , I 'm okay .
It 's what I want , " she mumbled in exhaustion .
Simon Pardy mumbled for the third or fourth time in the aggressive undertone which seemed to be his preferred manner of replying to any remark .
` Yes , " she mumbled in a tiny voice .
Mum takes me to the doctor , our village doctor , who weighs me and mumbles about taking dieting too far and makes me an appointment as an outpatient at the hospital .
He 'd looked ashamed then , and mumbled about being sorry .
For some time now , it must be said , the Antiguan superhero has been mumbling about hanging up his cape altogether .
` Stupid bastards , " he mumbled on .
Tom mumbled on in his own way , a little flattered at the rapt attention he was receiving .
` O Lord ! " she said , speaking extra loud to drown out Tracy mumbling on about her womb .
` Hi , " he mumbled back , his bruised , swollen mouth making his speech thick .
Willie grew more reticent and mumbled out something that George could n't hear .

Athelstan was pleased he had judged the moment right because , by the time they reached the top of the rickety wooden staircase , Cranston was half-asleep and beginning to mumble piteously about how he missed Lady Maude .
He was mumbling again .
` OK , OK ! " she mumbled breathlessly before quickly picking up her suitcase and making her way into the large bedroom .
Mrs Taxos mumbled crossly again and opened one gnarled hand on the donkey 's back .
He mumbled unintelligibly and looked abashed .
To his surprise , the young man mumbled and shook his head .
He mumbled and sighed .
He keeps mumbling and chuckling to himself ; a likeably batty old buzzard .
